fields.title: Airdrop
fields.definition: A distribution of cryptocurrency tokens, usually for free, to wallet addresses.

fields.title: Altcoin
fields.definition: Any cryptocurrency other than Bitcoin.

fields.title: Atomic Swap
fields.definition: A smart contract technology enabling exchange of one cryptocurrency for another without centralized intermediaries.

fields.title: Bear Market
fields.definition: A market condition where prices are falling and pessimism is widespread.

fields.title: Bitcoin
fields.definition: The first and most well-known cryptocurrency created by Satoshi Nakamoto.

fields.title: Block
fields.definition: A data structure used to permanently record transactions on a blockchain.

fields.title: Blockchain
fields.definition: A distributed digital ledger of transactions maintained by a network of computers.

fields.title: Bull Market
fields.definition: A market condition where prices are rising and optimism is widespread.

fields.title: Cold Wallet
fields.definition: An offline cryptocurrency wallet used for secure storage.

fields.title: Consensus
fields.definition: A mechanism for agreement on a single data value among distributed processes or systems.

fields.title: Crypto Exchange
fields.definition: A platform where users can buy, sell, or trade cryptocurrencies.

fields.title: Cryptocurrency
fields.definition: A digital currency secured by cryptography and based on blockchain technology.

fields.title: DAO
fields.definition: Decentralized Autonomous Organization; a community-led entity with no central authority.

fields.title: DeFi
fields.definition: Decentralized Finance; financial services without centralized intermediaries.

fields.title: Degen
fields.definition: A slang term for a reckless crypto trader or investor.

fields.title: DEX
fields.definition: Decentralized Exchange; a crypto exchange without a central authority.

fields.title: DApp
fields.definition: Decentralized Application; an application running on a blockchain.

fields.title: Difficulty
fields.definition: A measure of how hard it is to mine a new block in a blockchain.

fields.title: Ethereum
fields.definition: A decentralized platform that enables smart contracts and decentralized applications.

fields.title: Fiat
fields.definition: Government-issued currency like USD or EUR.

fields.title: Fork
fields.definition: A split in a blockchain network where the protocol is changed.

fields.title: FOMO
fields.definition: Fear Of Missing Out; the anxiety of missing a profitable opportunity.

fields.title: FUD
fields.definition: Fear, Uncertainty, Doubt; negative information intended to influence sentiment.

fields.title: Gas Fees
fields.definition: Fees paid to perform transactions on a blockchain.

fields.title: Genesis Block
fields.definition: The first block of a blockchain.

fields.title: Halving
fields.definition: An event where the reward for mining new blocks is halved.

fields.title: Hash
fields.definition: A function that converts an input into a fixed-size string of bytes.

fields.title: Hashrate
fields.definition: The speed at which a computer completes an operation in the blockchain network.

fields.title: HODL
fields.definition: Hold On for Dear Life; slang for holding a cryptocurrency rather than selling it.

fields.title: Hot Wallet
fields.definition: A cryptocurrency wallet that is connected to the internet.

fields.title: ICO
fields.definition: Initial Coin Offering; a type of funding using cryptocurrencies.

fields.title: IEO
fields.definition: Initial Exchange Offering; a fundraising event administered by an exchange.

fields.title: KYC
fields.definition: Know Your Customer; regulations requiring identity verification for customers.

fields.title: Layer 1
fields.definition: The base layer of blockchain architecture, like Bitcoin or Ethereum.

fields.title: Layer 2
fields.definition: A secondary framework built on top of a Layer 1 blockchain.

fields.title: Liquidity
fields.definition: How easily an asset can be converted into cash.

fields.title: Market Cap
fields.definition: The total value of a cryptocurrency's circulating supply.

fields.title: Mining
fields.definition: The process of validating transactions and adding them to the blockchain.

fields.title: Minting
fields.definition: The process of generating new tokens or NFTs.

fields.title: Moon
fields.definition: Slang for a cryptocurrency's price rapidly rising.

fields.title: Node
fields.definition: A computer that participates in a blockchain network.

fields.title: NFT
fields.definition: Non-Fungible Token; a unique digital asset verified on the blockchain.

fields.title: Oracles
fields.definition: Services that provide real-world data to a blockchain.

fields.title: P2P
fields.definition: Peer-to-peer; direct interaction between users without intermediaries.

fields.title: Private Key
fields.definition: A secret code that allows access to a crypto wallet.

fields.title: Proof of Stake
fields.definition: A consensus mechanism where validators are chosen based on their stake.

fields.title: Proof of Work
fields.definition: A consensus mechanism requiring computational work to validate transactions.

fields.title: Public Key
fields.definition: A cryptographic code used to receive crypto.

fields.title: Pump and Dump
fields.definition: A scheme where a coin's price is inflated and then sold off for profit.

fields.title: Rekt
fields.definition: Slang for 'wrecked', used when someone takes a big loss.

fields.title: Rug Pull
fields.definition: A scam where developers abandon a project and take investors' money.

fields.title: Satoshi
fields.definition: The smallest unit of Bitcoin.

fields.title: Scamcoin
fields.definition: A cryptocurrency that is considered fraudulent.

fields.title: Sharding
fields.definition: A way to improve blockchain scalability by splitting data across networks.

fields.title: Shill
fields.definition: To promote a coin, often for personal gain.

fields.title: Smart Contract
fields.definition: A self-executing contract with terms directly written into code.

fields.title: Stablecoin
fields.definition: A cryptocurrency pegged to a stable asset like USD.

fields.title: Staking
fields.definition: Locking up crypto to help run a network and earn rewards.

fields.title: Token
fields.definition: A digital asset issued on a blockchain.

fields.title: TVL
fields.definition: Total Value Locked; the total value of assets in DeFi.

fields.title: Validator
fields.definition: A participant in a proof-of-stake network who validates transactions.

fields.title: Volatility
fields.definition: How much the price of an asset fluctuates.

fields.title: Wallet
fields.definition: A digital tool to store, send, and receive cryptocurrencies.

fields.title: Web3
fields.definition: A decentralized version of the web powered by blockchain.

fields.title: Whale
fields.definition: Someone who holds a large amount of cryptocurrency.
